intro: Chabertia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered chabertia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, fern-like appearance. Chabertia micrantha is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its native range.
